messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I've combined it. No, he's... Yes, sir, this is...
And I called to all at 24, somebody to come out here. Please, because he'd been called...
Is this on Norman Avenue?
Oh, it can be Tennessee.
What's the name of the street again, ma'am?
Okay, hold on one second for me, let me find it, okay?
Yes, sir. I'm calling about my son.
I don't have any family here or God.
Okay, is this Sheila Jones?
Yes, sir.
Well, Ms. Jones, we have your call. We haven't dispatched on it yet.
Y'all haven't dispatched on it?
No, ma'am.
What do you mean you haven't dispatched? You're not going to come out and nobody's coming out here?
Yes, ma'am. As soon as the sergeant gets an officer, he'll send somebody out there.
I mean, I've been sick. If he kills me, he keeps on calling somebody, he's going to kill me.
Why doesn't anyone listen? If he comes, he'll kill me. He said he's gonna kill me.
He said it right in front of the cable man. The cable man was in my house.
So it ain't like I'm making this up.
He called me and said I better not come outside and to watch my back. I think he hit my window.
I don't know what's going on.
Do you want him to kill me so you can put yellow tape around and say you got here just for the devil? Is that it?
I don't understand it. I'm scared to leave my house.
Okay, ma'am, we'll get someone out there as soon as possible.
I really just don't give a shit what happens, yeah.
